item.title: The silent, growing CKD epidemic signals action is needed today
item.description: Opinion: Driven by rising rates of diabetes and hypertension, what can we do to change the chronic kidney disease trajectory in order to improve patient outcomes, potentially save lives, and reduce the impact on health care systems in Africa and beyond?

item.title: Devex CheckUp: Fight over NCD declaration reflects tough year in global health
item.description: Despite objections from the U.S., the United Nations General Assembly approved a political declaration on noncommunicable diseases and mental health. Plus, NGOs might still have a role in the "America First" universe.

item.title: Why capital without knowledge-sharing won't solve the NCD crisis
item.description: Opinion: The NCD crisis in LMICs demands not just money, but partnership. By combining innovative financing with knowledge-sharing, we can help empower local entrepreneurs to build lasting health solutions from within their community.

item.title: Devex Newswire: Do NGOs have to come last in an ‘America First’ world?
item.description: The Trump administration’s global health strategy sidelines NGOs but experts say there is still a part for large NGOs to play if they can adapt and prove their relevance in this new reality. Plus, a new declaration on noncommunicable diseases defies U.S. power.

item.title: Kenyan Court Restores Seed Freedom: Landmark Ruling Boost for Food Security and Sovereignty
item.description: For years, smallholder farmers across Kenya have been engaged in a legal battle with the government over a law that criminalizes the practice of saving, sharing and exchanging indigenous seeds. item.title: Sudan war: World urged not to ignore ‘gruesome sexual violence’
item.description: Harrowing new details emerged on Thursday in a UN report detailing targeted sexual violence and summary executions in Sudan’s North Darfur region, attributed to paramilitary fighters who overran the city of El Fasher in late October.

item.title: Civilians at risk amid escalating Thailand-Cambodia conflict: UN rights chief
item.description: Intensifying air strikes and heavy artillery fire across Thailand and Cambodia have left civilians increasingly at risk, UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk warned on Thursday.

item.title: Can traditional medicine strengthen modern healthcare? An expert weighs in
item.description: Ginger and cinnamon are more than just ingredients. Along with other spices, their medicinal value is gaining both attention and legitimacy.

item.title: Syria’s humanitarian needs remain high despite reduced violence, UN warns
item.description: Humanitarian needs in Syria remain immense despite a year of reduced violence and political change, with millions still displaced, basic services strained and funding shortfalls threatening aid operations, senior UN officials said on Thursday.

item.title: World News in Brief: UN to evacuate Kadugli base in Sudan, celebrating migrant contributions, ending colonialism
item.description: The United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (UNISFA) will evacuate its logistics base in Kadugli, Sudan, in the wake of the “heinous attack” this past weekend that killed six Bangladeshi peacekeepers and seriously injured eight others.

item.title: Gaza: Access to food improves but living conditions remain dire
item.description: A pregnant woman in Gaza thought she might lose her child because of malnourishment. Ten days ago, she gave birth and is now in recovery thanks to World Food Programme (WFP) facilities that are back up and running again, the agency’s representative for Palestine said on Thursday.

item.title: Climate change mandates more innovation in yellow fever vaccines
item.description: A vaccine for yellow fever has existed for nearly 90 years, but new demand, driven by climate change, means innovation is needed. From Berlin’s World Health Summit, Devex explores the issue.

item.title: My Niece Was Killed Amid Mexico’s Land Conflicts. The World Must Hold Corporations Accountable
